tblrelations 0.1.0.9000
  • Reference

Left-join while checking that .y has primary key by

left_join_fk.Rd

Wraps dplyr::left_join() with extra checking and diagnostics.

left_join_fk(x, y, by = NULL, copy = FALSE, suffix = c(".x", ".y"),
  ..., na_matches = pkgconfig::get_config("dplyr::na_matches"))

Arguments

x

a data frame
y

a data frame
by

a character vector specification of variables to join by (with a foreign key relationship)
copy

as in dplyr... not sure this is needed
suffix

as in dplyr
...

as in dplyr, currently ignored
na_matches

as in dplyr, currently ignored

Examples

if (require("Lahman")) {
batting_df <- dplyr::tbl_df(Batting)
person_df <- dplyr::tbl_df(Master)
uperson_df <- dplyr::tbl_df(Master[!duplicated(Master$playerID), ])

left_join_fk(batting_df, uperson_df)
left_join_fk(batting_df, person_df)
}
